TITLE.P: EØS 006-2018 [EEA 006-2018] Procurement of a framework agreements for cleaning services.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Bergen kommune shall enter into a total of five framework agreements for the purchase of cleaning for municipal entities, for e.g. Schools, nursery schools, nursing homes, office buildings and other major and minor entities.

The individual agreements comprise the purchase of regular cleaning services (permanent cleaning), floor maintenance (buffing/polishing of floors), spring cleaning, building washing and window washing.

Facade washing is not included in the agreement. Building washing that is included in other agreements (for e.g. with the erection of buildings etc.) is not included in this agreement. The same applies to washing after the damage, that is including insurance rectification works etc.
The five agreements to be signed will be divided in the following manner:
— Framework agreement:
1) comprises Bergenhus borough, framework agreement;
2) comprises Årstad borough, framework agreement;
3) comprises Laksevåg borough and Fyllingsdalen borough, framework agreement;
4) comprises Ytrebygda borough and Fana borough and framework agreement;
5) comprises Åsane borough and Arna borough.
Also, refer to the more detailed description in the tender documentation.
Refer to the general description of all of the competitions.

Furthermore, framework agreement 1 is an inclusive contract. This means, in brief, that at least one disabled or disadvantaged person must be used in the execution of this contract. Further information/details connected to this, with inclusive contracts, can be found in Annex 3.3 Inclusive Contracts.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement shall have a duration of two years, with an option for the Contracting Authority to extend the contract for up to a further two years, with a total maximum of four years.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Refer to the general description of all of the competitions.

Furthermore, framework agreement 2 is an inclusive contract. This means, in brief, that at least one disabled or disadvantaged person must be used in the execution of this contract. Further information / details connected to this, with inclusive contracts, can be found in Annex 3.3 Inclusive Contracts.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement shall have a duration of two years, with an option for the Contracting Authority to extend the contract for up to a further two years, with a total maximum of four years.

TITLE.P: Framework agreement 3 Laksevåg borough and Fyllingsdalen borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Refer to the general description of all of the competitions.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement shall have a duration of two years, with an option for the Contracting Authority to extend the contract for up to a further two years, with a total maximum of four years.

TITLE.P: Framework agreement 4: Ytrebygda borough and Fana borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Refer to the general description of all of the competitions.
NB: This framework agreement includes an object outside of the boroughs of Ytrebygda and Fana.
This object is: Os Water Treatment Plant.
The reason for this is that Bergen kommune (Bergen Vann (Bergen Water)) is central in operation of this facility.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement shall have a duration of two years, with an option for the Contracting Authority to extend the contract for up to a further two years, with a total maximum of four years.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Refer to the general description of all of the competitions.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement shall have a duration of two years, with an option for the Contracting Authority to extend the contract for up to a further two years, with a total maximum of four years.

SUITABILITY.P: Registered in professional registers:

— tenderers must be registered in a trade register in the member state where the tenderer is established. As described in Annex XI of directive 2014/24/EU, suppliers from certain member countries can be required to fulfill other requirements in the mentioned annex.
Minimum requirements for the qualification requirements:
— the tenderer shall be registered and approved in the Norwegian Labour Inspection Authority’s cleaning register,
— tenderers that are not yet certified shall have submitted an application subject to consideration,
— if the tenderer is not approved by the Norwegian Labour Inspection Authority, the contract will be terminated with immediate effect.
Documentation requirement:
— copy of the certificate issued by the Norwegian Labour Inspection Authority,
— service providers that are not yet certified can enclose a copy of the application/confirmation that an application has been sent.
Registered in a trade register or company register:

— tenderers must be registered in a company register or trade register in the member state where the tenderer is established. As described in Annex XI of directive 2014/24/EU, suppliers from certain member countries can be required to fulfill other requirements in the mentioned annex.
Minimum requirements for the qualification requirements:
Documentation:
— Company Registration Certificate, which has been issued no more than six months before the tender deadline,
— confirmation of registration in a trade or business register as prescribed by the law of the country in which the supplier is established (applies to foreign companies).
Requirements:
— tenderers shall have their tax and VAT payments in order.
Documentation:
— tax certificate, issued via Altinn, the Tax Office or the Tax Collection Office,
— the certificate shall not be issued more than 6 months prior to the tender deadline,
— foreign tenderers are to provide certificates from corresponding authorities in the countries where they are registered for tax,

— if the authorities in the respective countries do not issue such authorisation, the tenderer must present a self-declaration regarding whether there are arrears on taxes and if so, the amount of these,
— the self-declaration must be signed.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Authority for issuing of expanded tax certificate: (Requirement in point III. 1.2. due to Missing drawing capacity in point III 1.1.).

As part of Bergen kommune’s fight against working life criminality, including illicit work and social dumping, a cooperation agreement has been signed between the Procurement Section of Bergen Kommune and the Chief Municipal Treasurer in Bergen.

The agreement regulates issuing of ‘expanded tax certificates’ for service providers to Bergen kommune. As follow up to this agreement, Bergen kommune requires that service providers in more defined competitions must submit a signed authority giving Bergen kommune the expanded right to an unlimited number of times collect information about their service providers’ and sub-contractors’ tax and duties conditions, as stated in the authority, as well as information about which employees’ salaries have been reported in the a-message. If the Contracting Authority considers it necessary to assess conditions regarding taxes and duties that the Chief Municipal Treasurer cannot give information about full authority will also provide a basis to be able to collect information from the Norwegian Tax Administration. Together with a signed full authority, color copies of the following documents should be sent in passport, bank card, drivers license or national ID card (the last named is for citizens in EU/EEA/EFTA) for the person concerned who signs the full authority.

Please note: the requirement for a signed full authorisation also apply to all of the main supplier’s sub-contractors, when the value of the sub-contractors services exceeds 500 000 NOK excluding VAT, or if the Contracting Authority requests full authority from sub-contractors.

The main supplier shall regulate by contract the provisions down the supply chain. When submitting the tender offer, a signed full authority is only required to be attached from the main supplier, unless the tenderer relies on other companies to be qualified.

If the tenderer must rely on other companies to be qualified in accordance with the Contracting Authority’s qualification requirement, a signed full authorisation must also be submitted from the supporting company / companies when submitting the tender offer, with a copy of ID in the same manner as for the tenderer.

Signed full authority from all sub-contractors as required, but that shall not be attached to the tender offer, must be submitted and approved by the Contracting Authority prior to the sub-contractors being utilised in the contract / project. Bergen kommune will only obtain information about the tenderers who, after the tender offer evaluation, have been selected as the winners of the competition.

Full authorities from the tenderers who are not awarded the contracts will be destroyed after the contract is signed. If the signed full authority from the tenderer is not enclosed with the tender offer, this will be considered as lack of fulfillment of the requirements set for the tenderer to be able to participate in the competition. Such lack can result in the tenderer’s offer being rejected. This also applies for companies that tenderers rely on in order to be qualified.

— signed full authority regarding expanded tax certificate (Appendix 1), as well as colored copies of passport, bank card, driver license or national ID card (the last named for citizens in EU / EEA / EFTA) for the persons concerned who sign the full authority.

— if the tenderer must rely on other companies to be qualified in accordance with the Contracting Authority’s qualification requirement, a signed full authority must also be submitted from the supporting company / companies when submitting the tender offer, with a copy of ID in the same manner as for the tenderer.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: — the assignment requires tenderers who have procedures and systems that ensure that the execution of the delivery has a low environmental impact.

— description of the company's procedures and systems for ensuring low environmental impact when carrying out the delivery. If the company has environmental certification or ISO 14001:2004 (or a more recent version) or equivalent third-party verified systems, such a certificate will be accepted as documentation for the fulfillment of the qualification requirement.
— the assignment requires tenderers to have quality management systems. Documentation (shall be provided in one of the following ways):
— — description of the company's procedures regarding quality management, with emphasis on quality assurance, resource management, continuous analysis, and improvement.
— if the tenderer holds an ISO 9001:2008 certificate (or newer version), such a certificate will be accepted as documentation of compliance with the qualification requirement.
